meanings.definition: Relating to or using only one ear.
meanings.sent1: She preferred the monaural headphones because they allowed her to hear the music clearly in one ear.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a monaural hearing aid for her left ear.
meanings.sent3: The monaural radio was so old-fashioned, it felt like listening to music through a time machine.
meanings.sent4: In a world where everyone had binaural hearing, she stood out with her monaural perception of sound.
meanings.sent5: The monaural sound of the bird chirping in the distance was a peaceful melody to her ears.

meanings.definition: A sound system that uses a single channel for audio transmission.
meanings.sent1: The monaural speaker was perfect for her small room, filling the space with clear music.
meanings.sent2: He connected his phone to the monaural system to play his favorite songs during the party.
meanings.sent3: The monaural setup was so simple, it made him feel like a DJ with just one button to control the music.
meanings.sent4: The monaural transmission of the announcement made it sound like the speaker was whispering directly into his ear.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the monaural recording felt like being in the same room as the musician, with every note crystal clear.
